Event: Being ditched by friends after being close and inclusive towards them.
Post: "Feeling abandoned and hurt after being ditched by friends who I thought were closest to me. Maybe I was too clingy or needy, maybe I'll always be the one left behind."

Event:
...

The main event in this post is the individual's struggle with depression and suicidal thoughts. The post expresses feelings of frustration, hopelessness, and despair, as well as a desire to overcome these negative emotions and lead a fulfilling life.
Post: "Feeling suffocated by my own mind, I'm trapped in a never-ending battle with depression and suicidal thoughts. Despite my efforts to shake it off, the darkness continues to consume me. Maybe I'll never be strong enough to overcome this, but I refuse to give up trying."

Event: The author is left heartbroken after a recent breakup and struggles with the idea of moving on and finding happiness again.
Post: "Feeling lost and uncertain after a breakup can be incredibly difficult. I'm struggling to come to terms with the fact that the person who was once the center of my world is now gone, leaving me with a void that feels impossible to fill. The thought of moving on and finding happiness again seems like an insurmountable task, but I know deep down that it's what I need to do. It's hard not to internalize this feeling of heartbreak as a personal failure or inadequacy, but I'm trying my best to remember that relationships end for many reasons, and it doesn't necessarily mean that there was anything wrong with me. #movingon #heartbreak #selflove"

Event: Threw a party to get back in touch with friends after struggling with depression, but relapsed during the party and isolated myself, not talking to my crush despite having feelings for her.
Post: "I was hoping to turn over a new leaf and reconnect with my friends after a tough battle with depression, but it seems like my party skills still need some polishing. I guess I still have a way to go before I can truly be myself around others - especially when it comes to my crush."

Event: The main event in the passage is the narrator's deep feelings of love and affection towards someone who does not reciprocate those feelings. The narrator has known this person for 8 years and has done many things to help and support them, but the person does not return those feelings. The narrator finds it difficult to move on from these feelings and is struggling with the idea of losing their friendship as well.
Post: "After 8 years of pouring my heart out to someone who doesn't feel the same way, I'm left wondering if I'll ever be worthy of love. Despite my best efforts to help and support them, it seems my feelings will forever be unrequited. The thought of losing their friendship is unbearable, but I can't keep holding onto hope that they'll suddenly realize how much they need me."

Event: arguing with husband and storming out, taking benzodiazepines to cope with emotions
Post: "Feeling overwhelmed and unable to communicate effectively, I resorted to storming out and resorting to benzodiazepines for a temporary escape from my emotional turmoil. Maybe I'm just not cut out for healthy relationships."

Event: Living with parents who don't accept me and are verbally abusive, causing anxiety and depression; feeling trapped and stuck in a bad environment.
Post: "Feeling suffocated by the weight of my family's rejection, I struggle to find a glimmer of hope amidst the darkness. Despite my best efforts to prove myself, their verbal abuse has left me feeling anxious and depressed. Trapped in this toxic environment, I fear that I may never escape the shackles of their disapproval."

Event: Living situation is unpleasant (stuck with parents) and work hours are poor (shitty). Socially, the individual feels isolated and unwanted (no friends, never been in a proper relationship). They feel they don't deserve to live a fulfilling life.
Post: "Stuck with my parents, working crappy hours, and feeling like I'm unworthy of love and connection. It's hard to see a way out of this rut."

Event: Feeling of isolation, rejection, and low self-esteem due to difficulties in forming and maintaining meaningful relationships.
Post: "Feeling like a ghost drifting through life unnoticed and unwanted, I've come to accept that meaningful connections are just not meant for me."

Event: trying to make something out of myself, moving out, getting help, making a turnaround, ending my life.
Post: "Feeling lost and uncertain about my future, I'm left questioning whether I'll ever find my place in this world. Despite my best efforts to make something out of myself, it seems like every door I try to open only leads to more obstacles and setbacks. Maybe it's time for me to accept that I'm just not cut out for this whole 'adulting' thing."

Event: Having a great social life, hanging out with friends, having a "girlfriend", and feeling happy and fulfilled until it suddenly ends due to changes in school schedules and friend groups.
Post: "Feeling lost and alone, I can't help but wonder if I'm the problem. My social life was great, until it wasn't. Maybe I'm just not cut out for friendship or love."

Event: Losing jobs, relationship, home, best friend, feeling stuck in the past, etc.
Post: "I can't seem to catch a break. I've lost my job, my relationship is on the rocks, and I'm struggling to find a new place to call home. It feels like I'm stuck in the past, unable to move forward. Maybe it's me, maybe I'm just not meant for happiness."

Event: ... Crying in bed, spent time in a psych ward, lost virginity and had it called off, cried at Christmas party, and contemplate suicide via electrocution.
Post: "Feeling hopeless and alone, I find myself crying in bed once again. Maybe it's because of my past experiences, like the time I spent in a psych ward or when I lost my virginity and had it called off. Or maybe it's because of the painful memories that still haunt me, like being rejected by those closest to me. Even happy occasions like Christmas parties bring me tears instead of joy. It's hard not to feel like I'll never be good enough when everything seems to go wrong. Sometimes I even wonder if it's worth continuing this struggle we call life."

Event: Burnout, break-up, indecision, post-breakup trauma
Post: "Feeling drained and unmotivated, I can't help but wonder if my lack of drive is a personal failing. Am I just not cut out for this? #burnout #selfdoubt"

Event: Danny got drunk and forced himself to throw up.
Post: "I can't believe I got so drunk that I forced myself to throw up. Maybe it's because I'm just not cut out for drinking, or maybe I'm just a lost cause."

Event: He broke up with me saying that he doesn't love me anymore at least not like a partner, and that he just wants to be alone.
Post: "Feeling like a failure after being rejected by my ex. I guess I'm just not cut out for love."

Event: Losing friends over the past two years without even saying goodbye, making the person feel worthless and scared of being alone forever.
Post: "Feeling like a ghost drifting through life, I've lost count of the friends who've disappeared on me without a word. Maybe it's my own worthlessness that's the problem. Am I just not worth the effort?  Will I ever find someone who'll stick around?"

Event: ... saw her WhatsApp status "I love ___" and it hurt me because I still have feelings for her despite getting rejected before.
Post: "Feeling like a love-struck fool all over again, I can't help but wonder if I'll ever be able to move on from the sting of rejection. Seeing her declaration of love for someone else on WhatsApp serves as a harsh reminder that my feelings aren't reciprocated. Maybe it's me, maybe I'm just not meant for love."

Event: My parents get drunk and start fighting, causing inconvenience and stress for the individual and their brother.
Post: "Feeling like I'm stuck in a never-ending nightmare, my parents' constant drinking and fighting has left me feeling helpless and anxious. Maybe it's my fault for not being able to handle their behavior."

Event: She lied to me about not celebrating New Year and not going anywhere, but was seen in a cafe last night drunk with another friend.
Post: "Feeling betrayed and hurt, I can't help but wonder if I'm just too naive to see the truth. My 'friend' lied to my face about not celebrating New Year's Eve, but I saw her drunk and cozy with another friend at a cafe last night. Is it me? Am I just too trusting?"

The main event in this passage is the attempt of the girlfriend to commit suicide, which had a profound impact on the narrator's life. The event is unambiguously bad from the narrator's point of view, as it has caused significant distress and harm to their relationship with the girlfriend. The event occurred in the past and has had lasting effects on the narrator's well-being.
Post: "My world was shattered when my girlfriend attempted suicide. I'm left grappling with the guilt and pain, wondering if I could have done something differently to prevent it. Maybe I wasn't supportive enough, or maybe I couldn't handle the weight of her emotional baggage. Either way, our relationship has been forever changed, and I'm struggling to come to terms with the new reality. #suicideprevention #mentalhealthmatters"

Event: The person has experienced various negative events throughout their life, including depression, suicidal thoughts, addiction, being tortured as a child, being labeled as a sex offender, and recently losing their daughter.
Post: "I've been dealt one too many blows in life. From the depths of depression to the hell of suicidal thoughts, I've seen it all. My addiction consumed me, and being tortured as a child left scars that will never heal. Being labeled as a sex offender has made me an outcast, and now I'm reeling from the loss of my daughter. It's hard to keep going when everything seems against me."

Event: A hard 1-sided breakup, depression, social anxiety, and a lack of happiness and support.
Post: "Feeling suffocated by the weight of my own emotions, I'm left to wonder if I'll ever be capable of love again. Maybe it's me, maybe I'm just not cut out for relationships."

Event: She told me her feelings were genuine and I shouldn't worry about anything, but then she admitted that she's not looking for a relationship.
Post: "Feeling like a fool yet again. I thought we had a connection, but she's not even looking for a relationship. Maybe I'm just not meant to be loved."

Event: My friends ignored my invitation to spend New Year's Eve with me and instead went out and had fun without me, causing me to feel upset and betrayed.
Post: "Feeling like a ghostly presence haunting my friend circle, I was left alone on New Year's Eve. Did I do something wrong? Am I just not worth their time?"

Event: A heated argument with an ex-friend that left the speaker feeling upset and angry, resulting in thoughts of violence and isolation.
Post: "Fuming after a heated argument with my ex-friend. I can't help but wonder if I'll ever be able to control my temper and anger issues."

Event: ... got a pay raise.
Post: "I'm grateful for the pay raise, but I can't help but wonder if it's just a fluke. Maybe I'm not as capable as they think I am."

Event: Living situation is unpleasant and restrictive.
Post: "Feeling trapped in my tiny apartment, I can't help but wonder if this is all there is to life. Maybe I'm just not cut out for the whole adulting thing."

Event: difficulties at home and college, feeling of heavy life, lack of real friends, struggling with oneself, feeling the need for support and therapy, and considering restarting medication.
Post: "Feeling suffocated by the weight of my own life, I'm struggling to keep my head above water. Despite my best efforts, I can't seem to shake off the feeling of loneliness and isolation. Maybe it's me, maybe I'm just not cut out for this whole adulting thing."

This event is significant because it has a direct impact on the individual's well-being and quality of life, and highlights the challenges that the father has faced throughout his life.

Despite my best efforts, I can't seem to shake off the feeling of guilt for not being able to provide a better life for my family. It's like I'm stuck in a never-ending cycle of self-blame and disappointment. Maybe it's time to accept that I'm just not cut out for this whole 'adulting' thing."

Event: Feeling of hopelessness and lack of motivation, difficulty in finding joy or happiness in life, struggle with rejection and low self-esteem, and a desire for love and connection but feeling unable to achieve it.
Post: "Feeling like I'm stuck in a rut, unable to escape the darkness that seems to follow me everywhere. Despite my best efforts, I can't help but feel hopeless and unmotivated. I long for joy and happiness, but it feels like an unreachable dream. Rejection and low self-esteem have become my constant companions, and I fear that I'll never find the love and connection I so desperately crave."

Event: Realized they might not really be true friends
Post: "Feeling blind-sided by those I thought were my closest friends, I'm forced to question whether they ever truly had my back."

Event: Thinking about someone and feeling confused and uncertain about whether you are in love with them, despite knowing that it is not legal or possible to be in a relationship with them due to their being your cousin.
Post: "Feeling torn between my heart and my head, I can't help but wonder if my feelings for my cousin are truly love or just a misplaced sense of connection. Either way, it's a bittersweet realization that our bond can never be fully realized."

Event: Got cheated on the whole time during marriage, stayed for the sake of the children, separated for a few years now, still legally married, unable to get divorce due to lack of funds, live with her while she is with another guy, feel depressed and consider ending life, struggle to take care of the children alone.
Post: "Trapped in a loveless marriage, I've been cheated on for years, sacrificing my own happiness for the sake of my children. Now, I'm left feeling depressed and hopeless, struggling to raise them alone while she's moved on with another man. The thought of ending it all crossed my mind, but how will my kids survive without me? I'm stuck in this never-ending cycle of pain, unable to escape due to financial constraints. #FeelingTrapped #MarriageMisery #DepressionStruggles"

Event:
Unluckiness

The main event in the post is the author's perception of being unlucky. They mention several instances of bad luck, including losing their first true love to cheating, having a roommate steal from them, and experiencing financial difficulties as a college student. The author expresses frustration and disappointment with their luck, feeling that they are a good person but keep experiencing negative events.
Post: "Feeling like I'm stuck in a never-ending cycle of bad luck 🤕💔 My first true love cheated on me 😔, my roommate stole from me 😡, and now I'm struggling to make ends meet as a college student 💸😩 It's like the universe is conspiring against me 🤯 I try to stay positive and do the right thing, but it seems like life just keeps kicking me in the teeth 😢 #unluckiness #badluck #lifeisunfair"

Event: The main event in this text is the individual's experience of depression, anxiety, and burnout. The events described include losing a job, moving from place to place, experiencing tinnitus and other health problems, and feeling disconnected from loved ones. These events have had a significant negative impact on the individual's mental and emotional well-being, leading to feelings of hopelessness and despair.
Post: "Feeling like a burden to everyone, I've been struggling with depression, anxiety, and burnout. I lost my job and have been moving from place to place, but nothing seems to ease the constant ringing in my ears (tinnitus) and other health problems. Disconnected from loved ones, I'm left feeling hopeless and despairing about my future."

Event: Finding someone who will love and accept me for who I am, making me feel happy and content.
Post: "Feeling grateful for the rare few who see beyond my flaws and love me unconditionally, even when it feels like the world is against me."

Event: ... Main Event: Talking to a therapist or doctor.
Post: "I'm taking steps towards healing and self-improvement, but it's hard to shake off the feeling that I'm just not cut out for this whole 'being human' thing."

Event: Thinking about the death of loved ones and feeling overwhelmed by negative thoughts.
Post: "Feeling consumed by grief and unable to shake off the darkness that's been following me since the loss of my loved ones. Maybe it's just me, maybe I'm not strong enough to handle life's blows."

Event: My friend has depression and anxiety and constantly demands attention from me, which can be emotionally draining for me.
Post: "Feeling drained from constantly being there for my friend with depression and anxiety. Maybe I'm just not cut out for this kind of emotional labor."

Event: Got married at 25 to my ex (then 23) after four years of dating back in 2014. She called it quits by March 2015 after less than a year of marriage. She moved out in April 2015, and I've had very little contact since last Summer. She finally got around to having us exchange divorce paperwork a few months back, and on Jan 12 we'll be having a quick trial for a no-fault divorce.
Post: "Less than a year into our marriage, my ex decided to call it quits. I thought our love would last forever, but I guess I was wrong. Maybe I wasn't good enough for her, or maybe she was just too young and naive to understand the value of true love. Anyway, we'll be having a quick trial for a no-fault divorce on Jan 12. It's a harsh reminder that sometimes life doesn't turn out as planned."

Event: My mother's mental health deteriorated drastically and she attempted suicide multiple times, resulting in her being unable to seek help herself.
Post: "I can't help but wonder if my mother's struggles with mental health are a reflection of my own shortcomings as a daughter. Maybe I should have been there more for her, or maybe I'm just not cut out for this whole 'adulting' thing."

Event: My mom asked me why I was feeling sad and I told her that I felt like a 5 year old who wasn't getting their favorite food for dinner.
Post: "Feeling like a 5-year-old who can't have my favorite food for dinner, I realize that life is not always fair. Maybe I'm just not cut out for this adulting thing."
